Title: Chief Imam of Owo dies at 91
Summary: Alhaji Ahmad Oladoke Aladesawe, Chief Imam of Owo and Chairman, Ondo State League of Imams and Alfas, has passed on at the age of 91 years .

Title: US decertifies Colombia as ally in drugs fight
Summary: U.S. decertifies Colombia as an ally in the fight against drugs . Decision could cost Bogota hundreds of millions of dollars in US military support .

Title: Trump slams $15b lawsuit against New York Times
Summary: US President Donald Trump filed a $15 billion defamation lawsuit against the New York Times on Monday . Trump accuses the outlet of a "decades-long pattern" of smears driven by feelings of "actual malice"

Title: Libya to deport 18 undocumented Nigerian migrants
Summary: Libyan authorities transfer 18 undocumented Nigerian migrants from Sirte Immigration Detention Centre to Sabha in preparation for repatriation . Libya to deport 18 undocumented migrants .

Title: Poor sanitation costs Africa $200b yearly, hurts climate resilience — World Bank
Summary: Poor sanitation costs Africa $200b yearly, hurts climate resilience — World Bank . Africa is losing an estimated $200 billion in annual economic gains due to poor sanitation . The shortfall could be reversed through urgent investment in water and sanitation systems .

Title: ‘I’m alive, recovering’ – Pastor Tobi Adegboyega speaks after undergoing surgery
Summary: Nigerian-born clergyman, Pastor Tobi Adegboyega has spoken about his recovery journey from cancer . Pastor Adebayega said he is 'alive, recovering' after undergoing surgery .

Summary: U.S. players can now gamble with Bitcoin and other digital currencies in minutes . The draw isn’t just about speed; it’s the mix of privacy, big bonuses, and jackpots that traditional casinos struggle to match .

Title: Japan political party to install AI leader
Summary: Japan political party to install artificial intelligence as leader after its maverick founder quit . The party's founder quit following a disastrous showing in recent elections .

Title: Air Peace delays flights over heavy downpour in Lagos
Summary: Nigerian largest airline, Air Peace, has said due to the heavy downpour of rain in Lagos this morning, some flights across its operating networks would be delayed .
